abstract: The distribution of FICO credit scores showed little change from 2006 — before the financial crisis — to 2011. While some people’s credit scores declined during the economic crisis, many others’ scores remained high or actually improved, because they became more conservative in managing their finances.

lead_paragraph: The distribution of FICO credit scores showed little change from 2006 — before the financial crisis — to 2011. While some people’s credit scores declined during the economic crisis, many others’ scores remained high or actually improved, because they became more conservative in managing their finances.

headline.main: Little Overall Change in Credit Scores
